description: The ``AWS::EFS::MountTarget`` resource is an Amazon EFS resource that creates a mount target for an EFS file system. You can then mount the file system on Amazon EC2 instances or other resources by using the mount target.

IpAddress.description: Valid IPv4 address within the address range of the specified subnet.

FileSystemId.description: The ID of the file system for which to create the mount target.

SecurityGroups.description: Up to five VPC security group IDs, of the form ``sg-xxxxxxxx``. These must be for the same VPC as subnet specified.

SubnetId.description: The ID of the subnet to add the mount target in. For One Zone file systems, use the subnet that is associated with the file system's Availability Zone.
